devdoc.author: Marto (built based on Abdulla Al-Kamil implementation)
devdoc.details: Feel free to make any adjustments to the code

params._amount: This is the number of outcome tokens purchased (signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)
params._outcome: The outcome(s) which a user is buying tokens for (1 for YES, 2 for NO)

returns._cost: The total amount of tokens received from selling the _amount of shares

params._token: ERC-20 token will be used to purchase and redeem rewards for this Market

redeemBatch(address[]).details: The list of accounts could be calculated using the "SharesBought" event

redeemShares().details: The redeem account will be the current msg sender of the tx

params._id: Unique identifier received on market setup
params._outcome: The resulted outcome of the market

params._amount: This is the number of outcome tokens purchased (signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)
params._outcome: The outcome(s) which a user is buying tokens for (e.g.: 1 for YES, 2 for NO)

returns._returned: The total amount of tokens received from selling the _amount of shares

params._id: The market id should be unique for each master
params._oracle: The address for the EOA or contract which will report the result for this Market
params._overround: AMM profit margin in bps (Note that 200 represents 2% of the subsidy)
params._subsidy: How much initial funding is used to seed the market (denominated on initialized token)
params._totalOutcomes: The number of different outcomes possible for this market (currently fixed at 2)

params._endTimestamp: Block timestamp when the market ends trading and enable report results
params._startTimestamp: Block timestamp when the market start allowing shares trading

params._newOracle: address of an EOA or contract that can close the market

devdoc.title: PrecogMasterV6: An implementation for liquidity-sensitive LMSR market maker in Solidity

_buy(uint256,int128,address).notice: Internal Buy function used by the public Buy function and PrecogMaster (to facilitate token approvals)

_redeem(address).notice: Internal Redeem function used by single share redeeming and redeem in batch

_sell(uint256,int128,address).notice: Internal Sell function used by the public Sell function and PrecogMaster (to facilitate token approvals)

buy(uint256,int128).notice: This function is used to buy outcome tokens.

buyPrice(uint256,int128).notice: This function tells you how much it will cost to make a particular BUY trade.  It does this by calculating the difference between the current cost and the cost after the trade.

cost().notice: Total amount of collateral spent in this Market  For example, if a market was seeded with 2000 PRE and then a further 20 PRE has been spent,  this function will return 2020 PRE.

getAccountOutcomeBalances(address).notice: Get amount of shares that an account owns for all outcomes (index 0 should will always be empty)

getMarketInfo().notice: Get current market state information:  total shares (all outcomes), shares balances (by outcome), current liquidity, buys counter, sells counter

initialize(address).notice: Constructor like function for the market maker

redeemBatch(address[]).notice: Used to redeem token gains in batch (could only be used by the oracle)

redeemShares().notice: Used to redeem token gains (only the market is already closed)

reportResult(uint256,uint256).notice: Used to report results of the market (only for defined oracle)

sell(uint256,int128).notice: This function is used to sell outcome tokens already bought.

sellPrice(uint256,int128).notice: This function tells you how much it will return making a particular SELL trade.  It does this by calculating the difference between the current cost and the cost after the trade.

setup(uint256,address,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Set up some of the variables for the market maker

transferOwnership(address).notice: Admin function to transfer the ownership of this contract

updateDates(uint256,uint256).notice: Used to update open market periods

withdraw(address).notice: Used to retrieve any liquidity left on the market (allowed only when market is closed)
